intro: Spergularia confertiflora var. polyphylla, commonly known as the many-leaved sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to sandy and coastal regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, often arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and alternate, with a distinctive waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. This variety is adapted to harsh environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
